text: Neile Graham (born October 8, 1958) is a poet and scholar. She was born in Winnipeg, Manitoba, and currently lives in Seattle in the United States. Graham serves as the program administrator for both the PhD in the Built Environment and the interdisciplinary certificates in Urban Design and Historic Preservation in the College of Built Environments (formerly the College of Architecture and Urban Planning) at the University of Washington. She also administers the Clarion West Writers Workshop. ==Awards== * 2017 World Fantasy Award for Special Award, Non-Professional for excellence in the genre as Workshop Director, Clarion West (nominee) ==Bibliography== *Seven Robins Penumbra Press- 1983 *Reinventing Memory – 1994 *Spells for Clear Vision Brick Books – 1994 *Sheela-Na-Gig Reference West, February 1995 *Blood Memory Buschek Books – 2000 ==External links== *Biography from her personal website Category:1958 births Category:Living people Category:20th-century Canadian poets Category:21st-century Canadian poets Category:Writers from Seattle Category:Canadian women poets Category:Women science fiction and fantasy writers Category:World Fantasy Award-winning writers Category:20th- century Canadian women writers Category:21st-century Canadian women writers Category:21st-century Canadian novelists Category:Canadian women novelists Category:Canadian fantasy writers Category:Writers from Winnipeg Category:Canadian expatriate writers in the United States
title: Neile Graham
